Downloader

seismonitor

class SeisMonitor.monitor.downloader.seismonitor.MseedDownloader(providers)[source]

Bases: object

Concurrent simple mass downloader for seismic data.

providers

List of processed Client instances

Type:

list

providers_are_processed

Flag indicating if providers are processed

Type:

bool

_stations_outside_domains

Stations outside requested domains

Type:

set

Warning

Client instances must implement the get_stations method Stations not available will not be downloaded

download(mseed_storage, chunklength_in_sec=None, threshold=60, overlap_in_sec=0, picker_args={}, groupby='{network}.{station}.{channel}', n_processor=None)[source]

Download seismic waveforms with specified parameters.

Parameters:

  • mseed_storage (str) – Path template for waveform storage. Supports keywords: {network}, {station}, {location}, {channel},{year}, {month}, {day}, {julday}, {starttime}, {endtime}

  • chunklength_in_sec (int, optional) – Length of each time chunk in seconds

  • threshold (int) – Minimum length in seconds for download

  • overlap_in_sec (int) – Overlap between chunks in seconds

  • picker_args (dict) – Picker parameters (batch_size, overlap, length)

  • groupby (str) – Grouping pattern for traces (e.g., ‘{network}.{station}’)

  • n_processor (int, optional) – Number of parallel processors

Notes

If providers aren’t processed, triggers make_inv_and_json()

make_inv_and_json(out_folder=None)[source]

Create inventory and JSON files from provider metadata.

Parameters:

out_folder (str, optional) – Directory to save output files

Returns:

(Inventory, dict) containing station inventory and JSON info

Return type:

tuple

Notes

If out_folder is provided, saves: - stations.json at {out_folder}/stations.json - inv.xml at {out_folder}/inv.xml

SeisMonitor.monitor.downloader.utils.get_chunktimes(starttime, endtime, chunklength_in_sec, overlap_in_sec=0)[source]

Generate list of chunk time intervals.

Parameters:

  • starttime (UTCDateTime) – Start time

  • endtime (UTCDateTime) – End time

  • chunklength_in_sec (int) – Chunk length in seconds

  • overlap_in_sec (int) – Overlap in seconds

Returns:

List of (start, end) time tuples

Return type:

list

Raises:

Exception – If chunklength_in_sec is 0

SeisMonitor.monitor.downloader.utils.get_filenames(mseed, filter_net=[], filter_sta=[], filter_cha=[])[source]

Get MSEED filenames with filtering.

Parameters:

  • mseed (str) – Directory path

  • filter_net (list) – Networks to exclude

  • filter_sta (list) – Stations to exclude

  • filter_cha (list) – Channels to include (if specified)

Returns:

Filtered filenames

Return type:

list

Raises:

Exception – If filter parameters are not lists

SeisMonitor.monitor.downloader.utils.get_inv_and_json(inventory, filter_networks=[], filter_stations=[], filter_domain=[-180, 180, -90, 90])[source]

Parameters:

  • filter_networks (list) – Networks to exclude

  • filter_stations (list) – Stations to exclude

Returns:

(Inventory, dict, list) - filtered inventory, station info, stations outside domain

tuple

  • segment_length (float) – Length of each batch segment in seconds

  • overlap (float) – Overlap fraction (0-1)

Maximum batch size

int

Parameters:

  • network (str) – Comma-separated network codes

  • station (str) – Comma-separated station codes

  • location (str) – Comma-separated location codes

  • channel (str) – Comma-separated channel codes

  • starttime (UTCDateTime) – Start time filter

  • endtime (UTCDateTime) – End time filter

SeisMonitor.monitor.downloader.utils.write_stream(st, mseed_storage, threshold=None, picker_args={}, ppc_and_comment=[False, ''])[source]

Write seismic stream to file with restrictions.

Parameters:

  • st (Stream) – Obspy Stream object to write

  • mseed_storage (str) – Path template for storage

  • threshold (int, optional) – Minimum length threshold in seconds

  • picker_args (dict) – Picker parameters (batch_size, overlap, length)

  • ppc_and_comment (list) – [preprocessed_flag, comment]
